item.title: Detailed instructions to contribute pictures with #GoPro Max 360° camera to #Mapillary: https://help.mapillary.com/hc/en-us/articles/360012674619-GoPro-MAX #OpenStreetMap
Really basic online #quizz and #poll app but free of charge and privacy respectful: https://www.onlinequestions.org and https://onlineclicker.org.
A friendly introduction to the #Fediverse: https://drwho.virtadpt.net/page/a-friendly-introduction-to-the-fediverse

Nice effort to #3D model the Trilogy of #Athens in #OpenStreetMap: - 3D view: https://demo.f4map.com/#lat=37.9808081&lon=23.7337054&zoom=18&camera.phi=4.872 - Article: https://www.reddit.com/r/openstreetmap/comments/iwlezz/i_3d_mapped_the_trilogy_of_athens/ #f4map
#OpenStreetMap Mapper of the Month #MotM is back with an article presenting Jacques Fondaire from #Belgium: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2020/09/16/jacques-fondaire.html
The Best Privacy-Friendly Alternatives to Google Maps: https://www.wired.co.uk/article/google-maps-alternatives-privacy. Of course, #OpenStreetMap is listed.

“Lights of the sea online Lights of the sea online” is an #OpenStreetMap-based interactive map full of blinking #lighthouses, light buoys and other beacons to discover and explore: http://beacons.schmirler.de/en/index.html

Training developers in writing secure code is not easy. What do you think of the Security Knowledge Framework ? https://www.securityknowledgeframework.org SKF is a fully open-source Python-Flask web-application that uses the OWASP Application Security Verification Standard to train you and your team in writing secure code, by design. #SKF #SecDevOps #OWAP #ASVS

#FOSDEM 2021 will take place on Saturday 6 and Sunday 7 February 2021 as an online event: https://fosdem.org/2021/news/2020-09-01-dates-fosdem-2021/. FOSDEM is the two-day event organised by volunteers to promote the widespread use of #free and open source software #FOSS, taking place in the city of #Brussels, #Belgium. #FOSDEM21

@openstreetmap Just noticed there are 575 EUR worth yearly donation to #OpenStreetMap unclaimed on #Liberapay: - https://liberapay.com/on/twitter/openstreetmap - https://liberapay.com/on/github/openstreetmap Would be good to claim it, no?

Did you know #OSMF has arranged for a #BigBlueButton server for the #OpenStreetMap community to use for your local community meetings, etc. Details: https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Tools/bigbluebutton

You can show your #OSMF membership (and a lot more other) with #badges on your #OSM profile on the wiki by adding the {{UserOSMFMember}} userbox to it: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Wiki_userboxes.

You can now join the #OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF as a voting member under the new Active Contributor Program, provided you achieve significant contribution, like 42 days of mapping over the last year or some other forms of contribution to the community (like organizing events, building software, etc.). https://www.reddit.com/r/openstreetmap/comments/id6m2y/join_the_openstreetmap_foundation_under_the_shiny/
@dajbelshaw Is Open Badges worth investigating in 2020 ? Seems it faded a bit, no ? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mozilla_Open_Badges #OpenBadges

“Open Advice” is a knowledge collection from a wide variety of Free Software projects. It answers the question what 42 prominent contributors would have liked to know when they started, so you can get a head-start no matter how and where you contribute. Read it: http://www.open-advice.org. It’s 310-pages long read, released under #CC-BY-SA, but organized in small chapters, so you can cherry-pick. #ebooks #FOSS #OpenAdvice

Great to see the paper “Building an open community: a new opportunity for scholarly projects” showcases the creation of open #communities with #OpenStreetMap: https://books.openedition.org/inha/4935. It identifies 4 principles to successful open communities: - open invitation - onboarding contributors - focusing the community - building a commons Probably, 2nd and 3rd are most difficult, and the paper gives good tips, but it’s worth sharing even more. What’s working best in your experience?

Lot of MapRoulette content these days. Here is an hour long video where Martijn van Exel @mvexel explains how to create a #MapRoulette challenge for #OpenStreetMap using #GeoJSON data from an external source: https://archive.org/details/maproulette-create-a-challenge-geojson.
#OpenStreetMap US has a 28-min Mappy Hour video presenting #MapRoulette: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=utuxHoRXDDQ.

#MapRoulette News for August 2020 by @mvexel - Easier Challenge Creation - Leaderboard Improvements - Global Live Activity View - New Translations - See Nearby Next Tasks - Set Preferred MapRoulette Tags - Showing Custom Base Map Layers in Editors Read more: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/mvexel/diary/393893 Contribute: https://maproulette.org #OpenStreetMap
A nice #tutorial on mapping artwork and memorials in #OpenStreetMap with #Wikimedia integration: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/skunk/diary/393826
